section: NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the foregoing premises and the mutual covenants set forth below, the parties hereto hereby agree as follows: <*$p$*>1. DEFINITIONS. Capitalized terms used, but not defined herein, shall have the meaning provided in the Strategic Alliance Agreement. The following terms, as used herein, have the following meaning: 1.1. "Accuray Regions" means Accuray's sales regions (as of the Effective Date). 1.2. "Customer" means any person or business entity with whom Distributor enters into an agreement for Products or Services pursuant to this Agreement. 1.3. "Distributor" means Siemens, its Affiliates. 1.4. "Multiple LINAC or Multi-Modality Purchase" means a purchase. 1.5. "Multi-Modality Purchase" means the purchase, on a single purchase order, of at least one Distributor imaging product. 1.6. "Multiple LINAC Purchase" means the purchase, on a single purchase order, of at least one Distributor linear accelerator product. 1.7. "Product(s)" means related products manufactured by or for Accuray for use in the radiosurgery market. 1.8. "Quote" means a quote provided by Accuray to Distributor pursuant to Section 2.3 that will serve as the basis for the Product configuration. 1.9. "Service(s)" means the performance of services by Accuray or its distributors. 1.10. "Service Agreements" means the Accuray CyberKnife Service Agreement. 1.11. "Spare Parts" means replacement or additional parts or Products. 1.12. "Specification(s)" means the current written description of a Product or Service. 1.13. "System(s)" means the Accuray CyberKnife Robotic Radiosurgery System<*$p$*>
explanation: In Section 1 Definitions, definition 1.4 states: 'Multiple LINAC or Multi-Modality Purchase' means a purchase. This is a structural flaw that does not make sense, because the defined term is equal to the meaning, thus it does not provide any details. There is no context or information provided to explain what 'Multiple LINAC or Multi-Modality Purchase' means.

section: 4.5. Import License. Accuray or its distributor will obtain and maintain all required import licenses, and shall serve as importer of record for all Products and Services delivered in or into any country or region, other than the United States, pursuant to this Agreement; provided, however, that if Accuray does not have a direct presence in or Accuray does not have a distributor specifically for the sales of Systems in the country in which the Customer requests delivery, as a condition to any sale of Products or Services to such Customer, Accuray may require Distributor (solely with the consent of Distributor) to enter into a distribution agreement with Accuray pursuant to Section 3.2 of the Strategic Alliance Agreement providing, among other things, that Distributor will obtain and maintain all required import licenses and will act as the importer of record for the Products and Services ordered by such Customer. <*$p$*>4.6. Warranty. 4.6.1. Scope of Warranty. Accuray will provide a warranty to each Customer that the Products will be free from material defects and perform substantially in accordance with the written Specifications provided by Accuray. "Installation" of the System shall occur upon completion by Accuray or the entity installing the System, as applicable. In no event shall Distributor, Customer or their respective agents use the System (or any portion thereof) for any purpose before Installation thereof without the express written approval of Accuray. Distributor
explanation: Section 4.5 states that Accuray may require Distributor to enter into a distribution agreement with Accuray, in order to obtain all required import licenses and will act as the importer of record. However, this is only with the consent of Distributor. The term 'consent' is ambigious in legal terms, because it does not define any procedure for consent to be determined.

section: Accuray will defend or settle any action brought against Distributor and shall indemnify and hold Distributor harmless from any liability, damages and expenses to the extent that it is based upon a third-party claim that a Product, as provided by Accuray to Distributor under this Agreement, infringes any patent issued in the United States, or any copyright or misappropriates any trade secret, and will pay any costs and damages made in settlement or awarded against Distributor in final decision resulting from any such claim, provided that Distributor: (i) gives Accuray prompt notice of any such claim; (ii) gives Accuray sole control of the defense and any related settlement of any such claim. Accuray will not be bound by any settlement or compromise that Distributor enters into without Accuray's express prior written consent. 10.2. Products Liability Indemnity. Accuray will defend or settle any action brought against Distributor and shall indemnify and hold Distributor harmless from any liability, damages and expenses to the extent that it is based upon a third-party claim that a Product, as provided by Accuray to Distributor under this Agreement is unsafe, and will pay any costs and damages made in settlement or awarded against Distributor in final decision resulting from any such claim, provided that Distributor: (i) gives Accuray prompt notice of any such claim; (ii) gives Accuray sole control of the defense and any related settlement of any such claim. Accuray will not be bound by any settlement or compromise that Distributor enters into without Accuray's express prior written consent. 10.3. Injunctions. If Distributor's rights to use and distribute a Product under the terms of this Agreement are, or in Accuray's opinion are likely to be, enjoined due to the type of claim specified in Section 10.1 (Accuray Indemnity), then Accuray may, at its sole option and expense: (i) procure for Distributor the right to continue to use and distribute such Product under the terms of this Agreement; (ii) replace or modify such Product so that it is non- 17 infringing.<*$p$*>
explanation: In Section 10.1 and 10.2 it states that: 'Accuray will defend or settle any action brought against Distributor and shall indemnify and hold Distributor harmless from any liability, damages and expenses to the extent that it is based upon a third-party claim that a Product.' There is a structural flaw with how this sentence is written. It should state the type of action, to make a distinction.
